reviews.text: Hotel Torrevieja is a decent 3* hotel but a little out of main tourist attractions. It is not situated in Torrevieja but in Rocio del Mar and you need a car to go anywhere, so that location is rather poor. However, rooms are clean, spacious and well equiped. Cleanliness in the hotel is very good and there is no problem with noise. Buffet breakfast is OK, tipically Spanish with plenty of food. For short stays and if you have a car and get a good offer, this hotel is OK.
reviews.title: Decent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a weeks B&B based on the reviews on this site. It is not a hotel for families or beach holidays, you need a car to go anywhere. But the hotel itself was very good value. We paid less than £60 for a weeks B&B, for which we got a room with lounge, 2- 4 foot single beds, balcony, bathroom, tea making, and the room was cleaned and changed each day. Yes we did have some smells in the bathroom but not too bad, the breakfast was a bit boring with fatty foods, but we found that going down for 8am the food was still hot., and there was plenty of other choice with cold foods or breakfast cereals Did not have full board and would not really recommend it, much better food just round the corner.
reviews.title: good value

likes.disliked: — Out of the way, lack of transport

reviews.title: Good Hotel, poor area
reviews.text: The pool was empty during our stay, and the disco only opened for a couple of nights and shut early, so no problem with either. If you are not sure, ask for a room with balcony, high floors, so the noise will be much less The chinese resturaunt on the main road is very good value, and a couple of the bars are ok, but very noisy being next to the main A332 road.

reviews.title: Wouldn't use it again!
reviews.text: There were plenty of spanish coach tours using the hotel and sometime
got very busy, but again, no problem, after all, it is Spain Not sure if we would stay there again, but for anyone wanting a base while touring/sightseeing, it is more than adequate
reviews.title: Better than last time!

reviews.text: hotel was good and rooms were fine and clean but the staff were ignorant and made it uncomfortable for us to be there.Definately a hotel for spanish holiday makers as we as brits were not made to feel welcome
reviews.title: be prepared
Pleasantly surprised
reviews.text: We recently returned from a holiday staying for 16 nights half board at the hotel Torre Joven whilst we were getting familiar with the area. When we booked because the price was so reasonable we did not know what to expect. The hotel was spotlessly clean and our room was kept exceptionally clean during the whole time. All the hotel staff were very pleasant and helful. The food could not be faulted, compliments to the Chef, plenty of it and variety. We found the hotel very convenient as we did all our exploring on the local buses which was quite an adventure and enjoyable especially on market day in La Mata. Our room overlooked the N332 but we did not find it noisy. Our only complaint, the safe in our room did not work, but, we were told they were in the process of replacing them all. 9/10 to the Torre Joven we would certainly stay there again.

reviews.title: Better than expected
reviews.text: We arrived late on Sunday 6th Feb. not sure what to expect having read previous reviews. Since we had only paid €100 for 4 nights for a twin room with breakfast we were quite prepared for a noisy stay and poor service as per previous reviews.

reviews.title: Everything ok but the bar
reviews.text: The hotel was easy to find just off the N332 lit up by a large neon sign which proclaimed that it was now a 3 star having been upgraded from 2 star. We checked in at 10.30, just too late for dinner. The room was clean and comfortable with ensuite bathroom (full sized bath), TV, fridge, tea and coffee facilities and air conditioning that worked via remote control (€20 deposit for the aircon remote and €10 deposit for the TV remote). We went for a meal at a nearby chinese and returned hoping for a night cap before retiring but the bar was closed.

reviews.title: Middle of the road - clean
reviews.text: After a good (undisturbed) nights sleep we ventured into breakfast and were pleasantly surprised at the quality and quantity of food available - cereals, fruit, cold meats & cheese, scrambled eggs, fried eggs, bacon & sausages, pastries, breads etc. We found the meal more than adequate and very relaxed. PS you do not have to clear your own plates away!!

Having strayed at this hotel for two weeks i can honestly say i wouldn't again. We arrived at the hotel late on sat 1st july and were just in time for the buffet dinner which is served from 8pm-10.30pm. we were greeted by a miserable waitress that couldn't speak a word of english except for what room and water. The buffet consisted of salad, fish, onion rings, fish, some unidentified meat and did i mention the fish?!..... oh and chips. After dinner we retired to bed to be met with the sound of the traffic from the N332 which was LOUD and the ladies and rent boys of the night at the bus stop. We also had the noise of the disco until 5.30 most mornings. Having an end room didn't help. The safe in the rooms didn't work so reception let us keep stuff in their safe.
reviews.title: could have been better
well pleased
reviews.text: The morning buffet was MUCH better with cereal, full english, continental, toast etc....

reviews.title: excellent value for money
reviews.text: We found the pool murky and it looked as though it hadn't been cleaned for a very long time with old plasters, sand,etc on the bottom. at one point my partner found a dead crab and fished it out. The staff did nothing except flinch when he showed them.

reviews.title: Go There
reviews.text: Our room was kept clean to view but on closer inspection under beds etc we foung possibly 6 months worth of dust and grime. Don't get me wrong we had clean towels nearly everyday and had to beg for a kettle and a fan for our sons room as it had NO AIR CON which made it too hot and stuffy. The bathroom was completley tiled so be careful that you don't slip and crack your head like my son did. Town was a bus ride away which cost a €1 there are some nice shops and stuff but it doesnt really get going til about half six at night.
We were very disapointed at the hotel and especially the buffet at night which was the same every day except from when the spannish bus trips came and then they put in some effort.
